incident_summary:
10-year-old boy is tasered by a police officer for refusing to wash the police officer's car. The lawsuit claims police officers drove their patrol cars onto the intermediate school campus, where Webb asked a group of boys which one would like to clean his patrol unit. R.D. raised his hand to say he did not want to clean the police officer’s car.
Webb then said, according to the lawsuit, “Let me show what happens to people who do not listen to the police.”  He then “shot his Taser gun at the boy’s chest,” said the family’s attorney Shannon Kennedy of the Kennedy Law Firm of Albuquerque.
department.name: New Mexico Motor Transportation Police Department

incident_summary: Off duty cop pulls his gun on a man and hits him in the face with his badge.
abuse_notes:
When they reached a dead end, the sheriff jumped out holding his gun, dragged Tafoya into the street and struck him in the face with his badge, prosecutors said.
"I said, 'Please, don't kill me,' " Tafoya testified.
"It's too late. It's too late," Rodella replied, according to Tafoya.
department.name: Rio Arriba County Sheriff's Office

incident_summary: Officer pulls a woman over for having expired tabs (she didn't) but really used it as an excuse to meet the woman. Turns off his dash cam and mic then contacts her several times after the stop presumably looking for a date.
department.name: Mt. Juliet Police Department

incident_summary: Officer straddles woman on the side of the highway and beats her repeatedly in the heat and face.
department.name: California Highway Patrol

incident_summary: Man was praying over his dead son in hospital when officers tased him and took him into custody.
department.name: City of Pittsburgh Bureau of Police

incident_summary: A decorated veteran police sergeant has pleaded guilty to beating a handcuffed man and now faces up to 10 years in prison. The DOJ said Arigo walked into the room were Bloss was being held and "shoved his head into the bench, and punched him in the head multiple times." Arigo also pulled the video camera out of the wall to stop it from recording, the DOJ said.
location_notes: Beating happened while at the police station
department.name: Fulton Police Department

incident_summary: Officers put a man into a van and then drive recklessly (probably on purpose) resulting in severe injuries. Officers then lie on the witness stand and have their testimony refuted by expert witness.
abuse_notes: McKenna was then handcuffed and put in the van, but not strapped in. He said police accelerated and decelerated the wagon, knocking him to the floor four times. McKenna’s injuries included three broken neck vertebrae and two ruptured neck discs. The case was so inundated with lies however, that none of the officers could get their stories straight so there were also reports stating that he “hit [his] head on police car door” and that “while being transported, pt. hit his own head against divider as reported by arriving officers.” As part of the lawsuit, Thomas J. Gibbons, McKenna’s lawyer, presented an expert opinion from a doctor who said McKenna’s injuries were far too serious to have been self-inflicted.
department.name: Philadelphia Police Department

incident_summary: Officer seizes and tows victims car despite not having probable cause for a search and leaves the victim on the side of the road in the winter
abuse_notes: Police left Zullo on the side of the road, 8 miles from home, with his hooded sweatshirt to keep warm. “When Mr. Zullo asked (Hatch) why he had to pay for the tow, (Hatch) told him that the tow cost was Mr. Zullo’s fault for exercising his rights,” the complaint states.
department.name: Vermont State Police

incident_summary:
4 Memphis police officers were recently suspended after they tipped over a portable toilet that had a human being inside.  31-year-old Joseph Hampton was allegedly being chased by police when he ducked into a construction site and hid in one of the toilets.
Read more at http://thefreethoughtproject.com/4-cops-fired-tipping-portable-toilet-man/#WcqxoQA3bHH8GMFA.99
abuse_notes: Officers exercised excessive force in turning over the portable toilet the man was hiding in.
department.name: Memphis Police Department

incident_summary: Officer raped a drunk woman he had pulled over.
abuse_notes: felony counts of sexual misconduct, official misconduct and rape of a victim mentally disabled such that consent was not possible in August as part of a plea agreement
department.name: Fort Wayne Police Department

incident_summary: Police enter citizen's home and confiscate property without a warrant or probable cause. Officers were upset that they were being recorded on the victim's property. Officers then arrest 2 people and threaten to use taser on one of them.
department.name: Collingdale Police Department

incident_summary: Police force entry into a home without a warrant and physically assault family members looking for drugs. Officers claimed they were let in voluntarily and then people started swinging at them, but those claims did not hold up in court.
department.name: Denver Police Department

incident_summary: Portland police use excessive force in arresting a man for Driving Under the Influence. Didn't look too bad to me, but a jury awarded $500,000 so clearly some people think something went too far.
department.name: Portland Police Bureau

incident_summary: Plain clothes police officers jump out of a van and try to pull a 12-year-old girl into their van. When she resisted, they beat her up. Later arrested her at school for resisting arrest (after she got out of the hospital)
abuse_notes: Officers arrested the girl even after her father identified her as his daughter and not a prostitute. Later arrested her for resisting their initial arrest.
department.name: Galveston Police Department

incident_summary: Police stop two men in a restaurant and ask for ID without reasonable suspicion of a crime. Then get in a brawl and arrest the men for refusing.
department.name: Detroit Police Department

incident_summary: Officer has sex with 15-year-old girl while on duty. Girl was in the police explorers program.
department.name: Wewoka Police Department

incident_summary: Police officer fires his gun through a man's door after a slow speed chase and with no indication that the man had any weapon. Killed 68 year old man.
department.name: North Augusta Police Department

incident_summary: Man drives his car into a ditch and police respond by ticketing him, threatening physical violence, and eventually punch the man in the face. Then try to confiscate the video evidence.
department.name: Mt Rainier Police Department

incident_summary: Cops pull over a car without cause, claim that a drug dog alerted on their vehicle, and seized cash that was in the vehicle.
abuse_notes: Pulled over for failing to signal, but dashcam shows that the car did signal. Also claimed that a dog hit on the car, but that was not seen in the video either. Then arrested the men for having small flecks of weed and used civil forfeiture to take their cash.
department.name: Iowa State Patrol

incident_summary: Police officer responds to a 911 call about an unresponsive woman. He proceeds to give her more alcohol, tie her up, and force her to commit sex acts. Then he lied to the FBI about it. He wasn't charged for the sexual assault.
abuse_notes: Theriot carried the woman into his office and tied her to a chair with a belt.  He then admits to removing he clothes and forcing her to perform sexual acts while she was barely conscious.  Theriot then left the woman tied to the chair in his office while he attended a meeting in another part of the building. After the encounter, Theriot continued to call the woman to harass her, and ask her to get together with him again.
department.name: Sorrento Police Department

incident_summary: Officers arrest a woman for recording them and charge her with resisting arrest. Jury acquits.
department.name: Naperville Police Department

incident_summary: Roberts stopped a 36-year-old woman on Interstate 44 in Creek County just after 2 p.m. June 15, offered her $20 for a lap dance and then instructed her “to use a U-Haul truck to move, so he could stop her and they could have sexual intercourse in the back” of the truck, an affidavit states. the 16-year trooper had turned off his dash camera and microphone during all three of the alleged sexual assaults
abuse_notes: Roberts stopped a 36-year-old woman on Interstate 44 in Creek County just after 2 p.m. June 15, offered her $20 for a lap dance and then instructed her “to use a U-Haul truck to move, so he could stop her and they could have sexual intercourse in the back” of the truck, an affidavit states. the 16-year trooper had turned off his dash camera and microphone during all three of the alleged sexual assaults
department.name: Oklahoma Highway Patrol

incident_summary: Roberts allegedly pulled over a 22-year-old woman on July 8 for a traffic violation and asked her “what she would do for that amount of money,” according to the affidavit. It says Roberts placed the woman in his patrol vehicle, drove her to a secluded location and had her give him oral sex. the 16-year trooper had turned off his dash camera and microphone during all three of the alleged sexual assaults
department.name: Oklahoma Highway Patrol

incident_summary: On July 22, Roberts allegedly pulled over a woman who had warrants out for her arrest and informed her that he “didn’t need to take her to jail or write her a ticket, but he needed some convincing.” He eventually drove her to a secluded location, where the rape occurred. the 16-year trooper had turned off his dash camera and microphone during all three of the alleged sexual assaults
department.name: Oklahoma Highway Patrol

incident_summary: Cop punches and kicks handcuffed man
department.name: Orlando Police Department

incident_summary: Officers threatens a woman with false arrest if she does not perform sex acts.
abuse_notes: The woman told authorities that Krumrey approached her in the parking lot of her apartment complex, while in uniform, and accused her of driving drunk. She claims Krumrey told her he could take her to jail or they could "work it out." She says he followed her to her apartment and demanded sexual acts. Krumrey reportedly told police that he was having an affair with the woman.
department.name: Seabrook Police Department

incident_summary: Officer on bicycle runs into a man on the boardwalk. When asked why the officer responds by getting other officers to beat the victim up, mace him, and arrest for disorderly conduct. Charged dropped. Settlement of $500,000
department.name: Seaside Heights Police Department

incident_summary: Police send SWAT team to execute a no-knock raid looking for a drug dealer that no longer lived at that house. Due to negligence and sloppiness a flash-bang grenade was thrown into a toddler's crib while he was  sleeping and his nose was blown off his face and a hole was opened up in his chest. Grand Jury has chosen not to press charges against the officers.
victim_notes: Husband, wife, and four young kids. Only the age of the youngest child is known.
department.name: Habersham Special Response Team

incident_summary: New York Police pistol whip a man in the face after he has surrendered and puts his hands in the air.
abuse_notes: The firearm was used as an impact weapon but was not fired.
department.name: New York Police Department

incident_summary: A DEA agent commandeered a woman’s identity, created a phony Facebook account in her name, and posted racy photos he found on her seized cell phone. The government said he had the right to do that.
department.name: U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration

incident_summary: Police pull over a vehicle for a seatbelt violation. Demand ID from passenger who refuses. They break his window, taze him, and extract him from the car. Department defends the use of force. Officers had no probable cause to order man out of the car
department.name: Hammond Police Department

incident_summary: Officers arrest woman for swearing. After the illegal arrest find weed. Courts drop all charges since the weed was found as part of an unlawful arrest.
department.name: Asheville Police Department

incident_summary: Police panic fire and shoot unarmed man.
department.name: Fairfax County police department

incident_summary: Police officer frisks a man (with reasonable suspicion) and then takes $1000 cash from the man. Pepper sprays him and later sprays a person that videoed the incident and asked questions. Officer was responding to a call about a man with a gun in the area.
abuse_notes: The search itself was warranted because of the call. The theft and spraying was not.
department.name: New York Police Department

incident_summary: Police officers lie about smelling marijuana and use that to get a search warrant. Video later reveals that they lied about it.
department.name: Montgomery County Sherrif's Office

incident_summary: Police officer on duty and in uniform steals popcorn from a convenience store. Twice
department.name: Toledo Police Department

incident_summary: Police raid the wrong house looking for a fugitive and shoot the owners non-violent dog in the process
department.name: Michigan Department of Corrections

incident_summary: Police knock out a suspect that is not resisting because they thought he had weed. He didn't. Also threatens to "fuck up" people videoing the incident.
department.name: New York Police Department

incident_summary: Officer steals an iPad from some people being booked into jail. Admits to the theft and is fired.
department.name: Panama City Police Department

incident_summary: Officer detains 87 year old woman and enters her house without a warrant after being told he does not have permission to enter.
department.name: Baltimore Police Department

incident_summary: Two officers commit perjury to get a judge to issue a warrant. Raid a person's house looking for drugs and the man jumped out a window and died. Grand Jury felt there was enough evidence to indict the officers on criminal charges.
department.name: Yonkers Police Department

incident_summary: Police raid the wrong house with a SWAT team and kill a 7-year-old girl.
abuse_notes: SWAT team may have been justified since they were looking for a homicide suspect, however the carelessness of not checking the address resulted in an abuse of people's rights.
department.name: Detroit Police Department

incident_summary: Officer turns a K9 loose on a man that was handcuffed and was not resisting arrest
department.name: Carroll County Sheriff's Office

incident_summary: Officer detains a man for giving the middle finger when he did not. Then arrests the man because he demanded an apology for being detained.
department.name: Houston Police Department

incident_summary: Woman wrongly and involuntarily committed for psych eval. Officers get her keys from her belongings and perform an unauthorized search of her home.
abuse_notes: Officers put the woman in the institution where she had to strip naked. They went through her purse to get her keys and then let themselves into her home. They said that her disabled husband walked down the stairs and gave permission but he is not physically capable of doing that.
department.name: Sauk Villiage Police Department

incident_summary: Civil forfeiture of 17,500
department.name: Fairfax County police department

incident_summary: UC Davis campus police mace student protesters at an occupy rally
department.name: UC Davis Campus Police

incident_summary: NJ State troopers hold a man down and cause him to stop breathing.
department.name: New Jersey State Police

incident_summary: Park ranger tasers a man in the back over a leash law violation
department.name: National Park Service

incident_summary: Officer calmly maces a man recording him without provocation. Arrested the victim and offered to let him go if he didn't release the video. Officer Adolphus Cannon is on paid administrative leave pending the outcome of an investigation by the Waller Police Department. The Texas Rangers and Waller County District Attorney's Office are assisting.
department.name: Waller Police Department

incident_summary: Officer takes a swipe at a man's phone when he was recording. Settlement of $37500
department.name: Honolulu Police Department

incident_summary: Officer steals money and jewelery from a dying man at a motorcycle crash. Prosecutors said Huntsman was caught on his cruiser's video camera stealing from John Scalesse, 49, who lay dying after his motorcycle crashed on the Merritt Parkway in Fairfield on on Sept. 22, 2012. They said he later told Scalesse's family he didn't see any money on his body; it was found under the seat in Huntsman's patrol car.
department.name: Connecticut State Police
